name: Plan of Manchester and Salford (c.1650)
description: Earliest known plan of Manchester, showing the town during the Civil War era. Survives as an inset on later Casson & Berry maps. Shows the Collegiate Church (now Manchester Cathedral) at the centre of the medieval street layout.
notes:
Not a standalone original â€” reproduced as inset on Casson & Berry maps (1741-57).
Manchester Digital Collections has IIIF manifest.
Also on Flickr: https://www.flickr.com/photos/manchesterarchiveplus/5280463248
Chetham's Library holds key physical copies.
